page.title: 11 Tourism in the Keith area
page.content: Although Keith itself is not a major tourist centre,it attracts a lot of passing trade and is a good base for anyone touring the N.E.of Scotland. One of the popular attractions is the Whisky Trail.The Trail follows a route of about 60 miles through beautiful countryside and includes visits to six malt whisky distilleries. The Festival of Traditional Music and Song takes place in Keith on a weekend in June each year.Ceilidhs,concerts and musical competitions are held featuring the traditional music of N.E.Scotland. Around Keith there are several interesting walks.One of the most popular is to the Falls of Tarnash which are on the Burn of Drum about a mile from the town. Visitors may stay in one of the 8 hotels in Keith,in bed and breakfast or at the caravan and camp site.
